details.who: Firefox users on Mac OS X who have installed the Adobe Acrobat plugin.
details.name: Adobe Acrobat NPAPI Plug-in
details.why: The Adobe Acrobat plugin doesn't work on Mac OS X in default (64-bit) mode, showing a blank page when users click on links to PDF files in Firefox. It also causes a significant number of crashes in 32-bit mode. There's more information on this blog post.

details.who: All Firefox users who have a version of the Flash Player Plugin older than 10.2.159.1.
details.name: Flash Player Plugin
details.why: Old versions of the Flash Player plugin are targeted by known security vulnerabilities, and cause frequent Firefox crashes. We strongly recommend all users to visit the Flash Player homepage to download and install the latest available version of this plugin. This is not an ordinary block. It's just an upgrade notification that will be shown to all users who have these old versions installed, asking them to download the latest version. If they choose to ignore the notification, the plugin will continue to work normally.

Todos los usuarios de Firefox que instalaron la versión 4.2 del complemento Cuevana Stream.

All Firefox users who have installed version 4.2 of the Cuevana Stream add-on.
details.name: Cuevana Stream (malicious version)
details.why: Español Una versión maliciosa del complemento Cuevana Stream (4.2) fue colocada en el sitio Cuevana y distribuida a muchos usuarios del sitio. Esta versión recopila información de formularios web y los envía a una dirección remota con fines maliciosos. Se le recomienda a todos los usuarios que instalaron esta versión que cambien sus contraseñas inmediatamente, y que se actualicen a la nueva versión segura, que es la 4.3. English A malicious version of the Cuevana Stream add-on (4.2) was uploaded to the Cuevana website and distributed to many of its users. This version takes form data and sends it to a remote location with malicious intent. It is recommended that all users who installed this version to update their passwords immediately, and update to the new safe version, version 4.3.

details.why: These versions of the add-on (before 2.0.788) execute code from a website in a privileged local browser context, potentially allowing dangerous, unreviewed, actions to affect the user's computer.  This is fixed in later versions.

details.who: All users who have McAfee SiteAdvisor lower than 4.0. To resolve this issue, users will need to uninstall McAfee SiteAdvisor/WebAdvisor, reboot the computer, and then reinstall McAfee SiteAdvisor/WebAdvisor. For detailed instructions, please refer to the McAfee support knowledge base.
details.name: McAfee SiteAdvisor lower than 4.0
details.why: Old versions of McAfee SiteAdvisor cause startup crashes starting with Firefox 48.0 beta.

details.who: All users who install affected versions of this add-on - beta versions 4.0 to 4.1.20a from addons.mozilla.org or lastpass.com.
details.name: LastPass addon
details.why: LastPass have announced there are security issues that would allow a malicious website to perform some actions (e.g. deleting passwords) without the user's knowledge.  Beta versions 4.0 to 4.1.20a of their add-on that were available from addons.mozilla.org are affected and Lastpass also distributed these versions direct from their website.

details.who: Anyone who has this add-on installed.
details.name: Remote Keylogger test 0 addon
details.why: This add-on is a keylogger that sends the data to a remote server, and goes under the name Real_player.addon.

details.who: All users who have version 1.1.1 or less of this add-on installed.
details.name: AXTARA Search (pre 1.1.2)
details.why: Old versions of this add-on contained code from YouTube Unblocker, which was originally blocked due to malicious activity. Version 1.1.2 is now okay.

details.who: All users who have version 1.6.7 or less of this add-on installed.
details.name: Suchpony (pre 1.6.8)
details.why: Old versions of this add-on contained code from YouTube Unblocker, which was originally blocked due to malicious activity. Version 1.6.8 is now okay.

details.who: Users of versions of 1.2.1 to 1.2.5 inclusive.
details.name: Video Downloader Pro
details.why: Versions 1.2.1 to 1.2.5 of Video Downloader Pro included code that violated our polices - affected versions send every visited url to a remote server without the user's consent.  Versions older than 1.2.1 and more recent than 1.2.5 are okay.

details.who: Users who have version 0.0.4 and earlier of the add-on installed.
details.name: Stop Ads Addon
details.why: Stop Ads sends each visited url to a third party server which is not necessary for the add-on to work or disclosed in a privacy policy or user opt-in.  Versions 0.0.4 and earlier are affected.

details.who: Any user with a version of this add-on installed.
details.name: Aktualizacja dodatku Flash Add-on
details.why: This add-on claims to be a flash plugin and it does some work on youtube, but it also steals your facebook and adfly credentials and sends them to a remote server.

details.who: Any user with version 1.3 or newer of this add-on installed.
details.name: Aktualizacja Flash WORK addon
details.why: This add-on claims to be a flash plugin and it does some work on youtube, but it also steals your facebook and adfly credentials and sends them to a remote server.

details.why: A security vulnerability was discovered in old versions of the Add-ons SDK, which is exposed by certain old versions of add-ons. In the case of some add-ons that haven't been updated for a long time, all versions are being blocked.

details.who: All users who have Savogram version 1.3.2 installed. Version 1.3.1 doesn't have this problem and can be installed from the add-on page. Note that this is an older version, so affected users won't be automatically updated to it. New versions should correct this problem if they become available.
details.name: Savogram 1.3.2
details.why: Version 1.3.2 of this add-on loads remote code and performs DOM injection in an unsafe manner.

details.who: All users who have this add-on installed.
details.name: Search for Firefox Convertor (malware)
details.why: This is a malicious add-on that is installed using a fake name. It changes search and homepage settings.

details.who: All Firefox users who have any Cisco WebEx add-ons installed.
details.name: Cisco WebEx add-ons
details.why: A critical security vulnerability has been discovered in Cisco WebEx add-ons that enable malicious websites to execute code on the user's system.

details.who: All Firefox users who have these versions of the Web of Trust add-on installed.
details.name: Web of Trust 20170120 and lower
details.why: Versions 20170120 and lower of the Web of Trust add-on send excessive user data to its service, which has been reportedly shared with third parties without sufficient sanitization. These versions are also affected by a vulnerability that could lead to unwanted remote code execution.

details.who: All Firefox users who have these versions installed.
details.name: Alibonus 1.20.9 and lower
details.why: Versions 1.20.9 and lower of this add-on contain critical security issues.
